DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study that address previous treatment(s) of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Earlier in time or order._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Prior Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/29/16 tt, curated for 9950; approved and released.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior ra
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiotherapy that would result in the overlap of the new and old radiation therapy fields?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 6 weeks elapsed prior to enrollment since the patient received any prior radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have radiotherapy within 14 days prior to entering study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiotherapy to tumor-involved sites?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy within 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy in the last 14 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with at least radiotherapy and temozolomide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to Cycle1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiotherapy to the tumor-involved sites?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has prior radiation completed at least 2 weeks prior to the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the total dose of prior radiation exposure to the site of recurrent tumor (for consideration of re-irradiation) less than or equal to 70 Gy and the duration since the previous radiation exposure to the site of re-irradiation is at least 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy to the brain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have radiotherapy within 6 days prior to entering study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy within 14 days before enrollment or 7 days if the involved field is small?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior RT to the ipsilateral chest wall or ipsilateral breast or thorax?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has prior radiotherapy been completed at least 2 weeks prior to day 1 of treatment on the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive prior radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior radiation, was it completed at least 1 week prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation (including palliative) therapy to any part of the body within 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy within 4 weeks (or palliative stereotactic radiation therapy within 2 weeks)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy (except for palliative reasons) within 28 days prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior abdominal radiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had more than one prior course of head and neck radiotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy in the last 14 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had radiation therapy within 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient received prior radiotherapy, has patient completed and fully recovered from the acute effects of radiotherapy and a washout period of at least 14 days has elapsed between end of radiotherapy and randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic radiotherapy with radium-223, strontium-89, samarium-153, rhenium-186, or rhenium-188 for the treatment of bony metastases within 24 weeks before the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 3 weeks elapsed since XRT, but at least 6 weeks if CNS or lung fields prior to leukapheresis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients undergoing leukapheresis: Prior to leukapheresis have at least 3 weeks elapsed since XRT, or at least 6 weeks if CNS or lung fields?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy within 21 days prior to the first dose of the investigational products?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior radiation to the head and neck or adjacent anatomical site for another malignancy, is there an overlap with current area to be irradiated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy within 2 weeks prior to start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive radiation therapy within 2 weeks after the last dose fraction of XRT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive radiation therapy within 2 weeks after the last dose fraction of RT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy within at least 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior upper abdominal radiotherapy prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received prior radiation, was it completed more than 1 week prior to entering the study and it was not to greater than 25% of their bone marrow?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received therapeutic radiation therapy within 21 days, or palliative radiation therapy within 7 days, of Cycle 1 Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have extensive RT involving greater than 30% of the bone marrow?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient started radiation therapy on NRG-GU009

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received other prior therapies for kidney cancer: radiotherapy less than 2 weeks  prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Previous pelvic radiation for any reason, including brachytherapy alone.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/29/16 tt, curated for 9950; approved and released.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 9/26/23 Added alt OID, CCTG and AQT for CCTG ticket number CADSR0002884 cjl.
